meanings.definition: To work a piece of land as a tenant farmer in exchange for a share of the crops produced.
meanings.sent1: The farmer would sharecrop the land to grow crops.
meanings.sent2: Many farmers in the past used to sharecrop for a living.
meanings.sent3: Why did the chicken want to sharecrop? To grow its own corn!
meanings.sent4: The idea of sharecropping can be like planting seeds of cooperation.
meanings.sent5: He decided to sharecrop to learn more about farming firsthand.

meanings.definition: A tenant farmer who gives a share of the crops produced as rent.
meanings.sent1: The sharecrop was happy with the harvest this year.
meanings.sent2: In the old days, a sharecrop was a common sight in rural areas.
meanings.sent3: The sharecrop told a corny joke about farming and made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The fields whispered stories of the hardworking sharecrop.
meanings.sent5: The sharecrop's dedication to the land was truly admirable.
